objective: Bypass the museum's cutting-edge security to liberate the legendary 'Eye of Amun-Ra' from its vault.

locations.name: The Nocturnal Loading Bay
locations.description: A sprawling, dimly lit concrete cavern at the rear of the museum, where deliveries hum throughout the night, thick with the scent of cardboard and exhaust fumes.
locations.visual: Large, concrete loading bay at night, delivery trucks, stack of crates, forklift, security camera, dim fluorescent lights.

locations.name: The Labyrinthine Staff Corridors
locations.description: A sterile, echoing network of cream-colored hallways and locked utility doors, leading deeper into the museum's unseen operational heart.
locations.visual: Long, empty staff corridor, institutional lighting, locked fire doors, CCTV camera, linoleum floor.

locations.name: Curatorial Offices Annex
locations.description: A hushed wing of private offices and conservation labs, where the museum's intellectual elite meticulously prepare exhibits behind frosted glass.
locations.visual: Quiet office hallway, frosted glass doors, 'Curator' nameplates, a few desk lamps glowing, art conservation tools visible.

locations.name: The Pulsating Server Room
locations.description: A high-security, climate-controlled chamber pulsating with the hum of servers and the frantic blink of indicator lights, the digital fortress of the museum's network.
locations.visual: Cold, brightly lit server room, rows of blinking server racks, network cables, heavy fire door, 'Authorized Personnel Only' sign.

locations.name: The Pharaoh's Inner Vault
locations.description: The museum's ultimate safeguard, a multi-layered steel vault bathed in soft, laser-grid light, protecting the mythical 'Eye of Amun-Ra' on its illuminated plinth.
locations.visual: Circular steel vault door, intricate laser grid, pressure sensors, single illuminated plinth with a glowing jewel, highly secure.

items.name: Utility Forklift Key
items.description: A standard key for operating the museum's industrial forklifts, essential for moving heavy crates.
items.visual: A simple, tarnished metal key with a large, rectangular head, hanging on a worn red plastic tag.

items.name: Museum Guard Vest
items.description: A reflective vest worn by museum staff, granting a brief, low-profile disguise in authorized areas.
items.visual: A bright yellow, slightly worn reflective safety vest with 'MUSEUM STAFF' printed on the back in black letters.

items.name: Smuggled Manifest
items.description: A hidden shipping manifest detailing incoming and outgoing crates, revealing crucial vulnerabilities and timings.
items.visual: A crumpled, coffee-stained paper manifest tucked beneath a stack of old pallets, with handwritten annotations.

items.name: Janitor's Keycard
items.description: A low-level access card, granting entry to service tunnels and less-restricted staff zones.
items.visual: A generic white plastic ID card with a faded photo of a middle-aged man, clipped to a retractable lanyard.

items.name: Obscure Floor Plans
items.description: Outdated but still useful blueprints of the museum's lower levels, revealing forgotten passages and maintenance shafts.
items.visual: Large, rolled-up parchment blueprints, yellowed with age, showing intricate ventilation shafts and utility lines.

items.name: Curator's Data Stick
items.description: A USB drive containing partial security schedules and email correspondence, hinting at vault access codes.
items.visual: A sleek, metallic USB flash drive with a small, glowing blue indicator light, slightly warm to the touch.

items.name: Scrawled Memo
items.description: A hastily scrawled note containing a fragment of the vault's access sequence, hidden in plain sight.
items.visual: A small, torn piece of yellow legal pad paper with a series of numbers and symbols scribbled in pencil, tucked under a blotter.

items.name: Server Room Interface
items.description: A custom-built device for bypassing network authentication and granting backdoor access to the museum's systems.
items.visual: A compact, black electronic device with several blinking LED lights and a tangle of specialized ethernet cables.

items.name: The Eye of Osiris
items.description: A legendary sapphire, rumored to grant foresight, mounted in an ancient golden hawk effigy. The primary target.
items.visual: A fist-sized, deep blue sapphire, perfectly cut, set within the eye socket of an ornate, solid gold hawk statue with intricate hieroglyphs.

items.name: The Scroll of Thoth
items.description: An ancient papyrus scroll believed to contain forgotten knowledge. A valuable secondary target, highly fragile.
items.visual: A brittle, rolled papyrus scroll, sealed with an ancient clay stamp depicting an ibis-headed deity, radiating an aura of antiquity.

npcs.name: Arthur Finch
npcs.personality: Arthur is a man drowning in administrative duties, always on the verge of a minor panic attack about budgets and deadlines. He prides himself on the museum's impeccable record, making him extra vigilant tonight due to the 'Eye of Amun-Ra' exhibit, but also easily flustered by unexpected disruptions.

information_known.description: The vault's digital access protocol was updated last week, now requiring dual-factor authentication for anyone accessing it, even senior staff.
He has a master keycard override for the server room, but it requires a biometric scan from the Head of Security to activate.
He knows the exact layout of the Curatorial Offices Annex, including a rarely used maintenance duct leading towards the staff corridors.

actions_available.description: If convinced that IT is performing an urgent system check, he might reveal his network credentials for 'troubleshooting'.

cover_options.description: I'm a new IT support specialist here to perform an urgent, unscheduled system diagnostic.
cover_options.npc_reaction: He'd be annoyed by the lack of prior notice but would likely cooperate if the tone is authoritative and emphasizes security, demanding to see official ID.

cover_options.description: I'm an external archivist consultant here for a late-night review of the 'Eye of Amun-Ra' exhibit's documentation.
cover_options.npc_reaction: He would demand official paperwork and an appointment, highly suspicious of unscheduled visits and unauthorized access to sensitive documents.

cover_options.description: I'm the lead HVAC technician, responding to an emergency temperature fluctuation report from the server room.
cover_options.npc_reaction: He would be immediately concerned about the server room and direct the player to relevant areas, but would want to verify the report and request proof of identity.

npcs.clothing: A slightly rumpled grey suit, loosened tie, and spectacles perched on his nose.
npcs.expression: Harried, with a perpetual slight frown etched between his brows.
npcs.attitude: Overworked and stressed, but deeply committed to the museum's reputation and security.
npcs.details: A well-used pen perpetually tucked behind his right ear.
npcs.relationships: He sees the 'receptionist' Chloe Davies as generally competent but often distracted, a necessary cog in the administrative machine he oversees.
npcs.story_context: He is the primary gatekeeper of administrative access and critical digital information within the Curatorial Offices Annex.

npcs.name: Chloe Davies
npcs.personality: Chloe is usually cheerful and efficient, but tonight she's a bit bored and restless, wishing her shift was over. She enjoys a good chat to pass the time, but she's also acutely aware of her responsibilities, especially with the high-profile exhibit currently on display.

information_known.description: She knows the current night shift security rotation schedule for the staff corridors, including when specific guards take their breaks and patrol routes.
She overheard the new temporary code for the Nocturnal Loading Bay being discussed earlier, though she can't recall it perfectly, only that it changed from the usual.
She knows that only senior curatorial staff and specific security personnel have level-4 keycard access to the Pharaoh's Inner Vault approaches.

actions_available.description: She can be easily engaged in conversation, making her less attentive to CCTV monitors or peripheral activity for a short period.
She might grant temporary access to a restricted area (e.g., a specific office) if a convincing, low-risk emergency is fabricated, provided it doesn't involve the vault itself.

cover_options.description: I'm a late-night delivery driver with a special package for the 'Eye of Amun-Ra' curator.
cover_options.npc_reaction: She'd be slightly annoyed by the late hour but would direct them to the Nocturnal Loading Bay or attempt to contact the curator, asking for a delivery manifest.

cover_options.description: I'm a new night-shift volunteer, reporting for my first shift to assist with exhibit setup.
cover_options.npc_reaction: She'd be friendly and helpful, offering directions and basic instructions, but would verify their name on a roster and ask about their assigned tasks.

cover_options.description: I'm a visiting scholar here to collect some research materials I left in one of the curatorial offices.
cover_options.npc_reaction: She would ask for identification and an appointment time, reluctant to grant unscheduled access to private offices without proper authorization.

npcs.clothing: A smart but comfortable navy blouse and tailored trousers, with a museum-branded lanyard.
npcs.expression: Generally pleasant, but a little bored and occasionally checking her phone under the desk.
npcs.attitude: Friendly and helpful, but also a stickler for rules when she's paying attention.
npcs.details: A small, intricate tattoo of a hieroglyph on her left wrist, peeking out from her sleeve.
npcs.relationships: She views 'manager' Arthur Finch as a typical, perpetually stressed boss, a bit of a stick-in-the-mud but generally fair.
npcs.story_context: She controls immediate access to certain restricted staff areas and is a valuable source of real-time information about staff movements.

tasks.description: Engage the receptionist in casual conversation to divert attention and gather intel on staff movements.
Receive the decrypted vault schematics from the hacker, preparing for the final breach.
Discreetly search the curator's office for the hidden memo containing critical vault fragments.
Scan the vault's security systems for overlooked vulnerabilities and potential digital backdoors.
Transmit the updated security layouts and personnel schedules to the mastermind's device.
Execute the final digital sequence to disarm the vault's laser grid and pressure plate sensors.
Secure the getaway vehicle at the loading bay, ensuring a clear path for a swift extraction.
Wipe all digital traces from the museum's servers and disable external tracking systems for a clean getaway.
